snippet: Members have been debating divestment to pressure Israel to stop building settlements and to take steps toward a peaceful resolution with the Palestinians.
abstract: Decision by pension board of United Methodist Church to sell stock in company that provides security equipment to Israeli prisons sets off backlash from Israel's supporters, who are facing another fight over divestment at convention of another mainline Protestant denomination, the Presbyterian Church (USA); members of both churches have been debating divestment for years, part of larger campaign to pressure Israel to stop building settlements and take steps toward peace with Palestinians.
lead_paragraph: Members have been debating divestment to pressure Israel to stop building settlements and to take steps toward a peaceful resolution with the Palestinians.

headline.main: Methodist Church Pension Board Links Divestment to Firm’s Role in Israeli Prisons
headline.print_headline: Methodist Church Pension Board Links Divestment to Firm’s Role in Israeli Prisons
